intro: Monnina bifurcata, commonly known as narrowleaf monnina, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Monnina bifurcata is used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
